member.name: T:Orleans.Runtime.MultiClusterNetwork.AzureTableBasedGossipChannel
member.summary: An implementation of a gossip channel based on a standard Orleans Azure table. Multiple gossip networks can use the same table, and are separated by partition key = GlobalServiceId

member.summary: Low level representation details and functionality for Azure-Table-Based Gossip Channels

member.summary: Try once to insert a new data entry in the Azure table. Returns false if there is a conflict.

member.name: M:Orleans.Runtime.MultiClusterNetwork.GossipTableInstanceManager.TryDeleteTableEntryAsync(Orleans.Runtime.MultiClusterNetwork.GossipTableEntry,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Try once to delete a data entry in the Azure table. Returns false if there is a conflict.

member.name: T:Orleans.Runtime.Configuration.AzureConfigurationExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for configuration classes specific to OrleansAzureUtils.dll

member.summary: Adds a storage provider of type .
member.param: The cluster configuration object to add provider to.
The provider name.
The azure storage connection string. If none is provided, it will use the same as in the Globals configuration.
The table name where to store the state.
Whether the provider deletes the state when is called.
Whether is stores the content as JSON or as binary in Azure Table.
Whether to use full assembly names in the serialized JSON. This value is ignored if is false.
Whether to indent (pretty print) the JSON. This value is ignored if is false.

member.summary: Adds a storage provider of type .
member.param: The cluster configuration object to add provider to.
The provider name.
The azure storage connection string. If none is provided, it will use the same as in the Globals configuration.
The container name where to store the state.
Whether to use full assembly names in the serialized JSON.
Whether to indent (pretty print) the JSON.

member.summary: Adds a stream provider of type .
member.param: The cluster configuration object to add provider to.
The provider name
The azure storage connection string. If none is provided, it will use the same as in the Globals configuration.
The number of queues to use as partitions.
The deployment ID used for partitioning. If none is specified, the provider will use the same DeploymentId as the Cluster.
The cache size.
The startup state of the persistent stream provider.
Settings related to all persistent stream providers.

member.summary: Adds a stream provider of type .

member.param: Name of the file to be found.
Short description of the file to be found.
member.returns: Location if the file, if found, otherwise FileNotFound exeception will be thrown.
member.exception: If the specified config file cannot be located

member.summary: Return the expected possible base locations for the Azure app directory we are being run from

member.name: T:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureClient
member.summary: Utility class for initializing an Orleans client running inside Azure.

member.name: F:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureClient.MaxRetries
member.summary: Number of retry attempts to make when searching for gateway silos to connect to.

member.name: F:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureClient.StartupRetryPause
member.summary: Amount of time to pause before each retry attempt.

member.name: P:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureClient.IsInitialized
member.summary: Whether the Orleans Azure client runtime has already been initialized
member.returns: true if client runtime is already initialized

member.name: M:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureClient.Initialize
member.summary: Initialise the Orleans client runtime in this Azure process

member.name: M:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureClient.Initialize(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Initialise the Orleans client runtime in this Azure process
member.param: Location of the Orleans client config file to use for base config settings
member.remarks: Any silo gateway address specified in the config file is ignored, and gateway endpoint info is read from the silo instance table in Azure storage instead.

member.summary: Initialise the Orleans client runtime in this Azure process
member.param: Location of the Orleans client config file to use for base config settings
member.remarks: Any silo gateway address specified in the config file is ignored, and gateway endpoint info is read from the silo instance table in Azure storage instead.

member.name: M:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureClient.Initialize(Orleans.Runtime.Configuration.ClientConfiguration)

member.param: A ClientConfiguration object.

member.name: M:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureClient.Uninitialize
member.summary: Uninitializes the Orleans client runtime in this Azure process.

member.name: M:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureClient.DefaultConfiguration
member.summary: Returns default client configuration object for passing to AzureClient.

member.name: T:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureSilo
member.summary: Wrapper class for an Orleans silo running in the current host process.

member.name: P:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureSilo.StartupRetryPause
member.summary: Amount of time to pause before retrying if a secondary silo is unable to connect to the primary silo for this deployment. Defaults to 5 seconds.

member.name: P:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureSilo.MaxRetries
member.summary: Number of times to retrying if a secondary silo is unable to connect to the primary silo for this deployment. Defaults to 120 times.

member.name: P:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureSilo.DataConnectionConfigurationSettingName
member.summary: The name of the configuration key value for locating the DataConnectionString setting from the Azure configuration for this role. Defaults to DataConnectionString

member.name: P:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureSilo.SiloEndpointConfigurationKeyName
member.summary: The name of the configuration key value for locating the OrleansSiloEndpoint setting from the Azure configuration for this role. Defaults to OrleansSiloEndpoint

member.name: P:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureSilo.ProxyEndpointConfigurationKeyName
member.summary: The name of the configuration key value for locating the OrleansProxyEndpoint setting from the Azure configuration for this role. Defaults to OrleansProxyEndpoint

member.summary: Initialize this Orleans silo for execution with the specified Azure deploymentId
member.param: If null, Config data will be read from silo config file as normal, otherwise use the specified config data.
Azure DeploymentId this silo is running under
Azure DataConnectionString. If null, defaults to the DataConnectionString setting from the Azure configuration for this role.
member.returns: true is the silo startup was successful

member.name: M:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureSilo.Run
member.summary: Makes this Orleans silo begin executing and become active. Note: This method call will only return control back to the caller when the silo is shutdown.

member.summary: Makes this Orleans silo begin executing and become active. Note: This method call will only return control back to the caller when the silo is shutdown or an external request for cancellation has been issued.
member.param: Cancellation token.

member.name: M:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureSilo.Stop
member.summary: Stop this Orleans silo executing.

member.name: M:Orleans.Runtime.Host.AzureSilo.RunImpl(System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken})
member.summary: Run method helper.
member.remarks: Makes this Orleans silo begin executing and become active. Note: This method call will only return control back to the caller when the silo is shutdown or an external request for cancellation has been issued.
member.param: Optional cancellation token.

member.name: T:Orleans.Runtime.Host.ServiceRuntimeWrapper
member.summary: The purpose of this class is to wrap the functionality provided by Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ServiceRuntime.dll, so that we can access it via Reflection, and not have a compile-time dependency on it. Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ServiceRuntime.dll doesn't have an official NuGet package. By loading it via Reflection we solve this problem, and do not need an assembly binding redirect for it, as we can call any compatible version. Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ServiceRuntime.dll hasn't changed in years, so the chance of a breaking change is relatively low.

member.name: T:Orleans.Storage.AzureBlobStorage
member.summary: Simple storage provider for writing grain state data to Azure blob storage in JSON format.

remarks.para: Optional configuration params: ContainerName -- defaults to grainstate SerializeTypeNames -- defaults to OrleansGrainState PreserveReferencesHandling -- defaults to false UseFullAssemblyNames -- defaults to false IndentJSON -- defaults to false

member.example:
Example configuration for this storage provider in OrleansConfiguration.xml file:
<OrleansConfiguration xmlns="urn:orleans"> <Globals> <StorageProviders> <Provider Type="Orleans.Storage.AzureBlobStorage" Name="AzureStore" DataConnectionString="UseDevelopmentStorage=true" /> </StorageProviders>

member.name: P:Orleans.Storage.AzureBlobStorage.Log
member.summary: Logger used by this storage provider instance.

member.summary: Name of this storage provider instance.

member.summary: Initialization function for this storage provider.

member.name: M:Orleans.Storage.AzureBlobStorage.Close
member.summary: Shutdown this storage provider.

member.summary: Read state data function for this storage provider.

member.summary: Write state data function for this storage provider.

member.summary: Clear / Delete state data function for this storage provider.

member.name: T:Orleans.Storage.AzureTableStorage
member.summary: Simple storage provider for writing grain state data to Azure table storage.

remarks.para: Optional configuration params: TableName -- defaults to OrleansGrainState DeleteStateOnClear -- defaults to false

member.example:
Example configuration for this storage provider in OrleansConfiguration.xml file:
<OrleansConfiguration xmlns="urn:orleans"> <Globals> <StorageProviders> <Provider Type="Orleans.Storage.AzureTableStorage" Name="AzureStore" DataConnectionString="UseDevelopmentStorage=true" DeleteStateOnClear="true" /> </StorageProviders>

member.name: P:Orleans.Storage.AzureTableStorage.Name

member.summary: Initialization function for this storage provider.

member.summary: Shutdown this storage provider.

member.summary: Clear / Delete state data function for this storage provider.
member.remarks: If the DeleteStateOnClear is set to true then the table row for this grain will be deleted / removed, otherwise the table row will be cleared by overwriting with default / null values.

member.summary: Id of the subscription on which this delivery failure occured.

member.summary: Name of the stream provider generating this failure.

member.summary: Guid Id of the stream on which the failure occured.

member.summary: Namespace of the stream on which the failure occured.

member.summary: Serialized sequence token of the event that failed delivery.

member.name: M:Orleans.Providers.Streams.PersistentStreams.StreamDeliveryFailureEntity.SetPartitionKey(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the partition key before persist call.

member.name: M:Orleans.Providers.Streams.PersistentStreams.StreamDeliveryFailureEntity.MakeDefaultPartitionKey(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Default partition key

member.name: M:Orleans.Providers.Streams.PersistentStreams.StreamDeliveryFailureEntity.SetRowkey
member.summary: Sets the row key before persist call

member.name: M:Orleans.Providers.Streams.PersistentStreams.StreamDeliveryFailureEntity.SetSequenceToken(Orleans.Streams.StreamSequenceToken)
member.summary: Sets sequence token by serializing it to property.

member.name: M:Orleans.Providers.Streams.PersistentStreams.StreamDeliveryFailureEntity.GetSequenceToken
member.summary: Gets sequence token by deserializing it from property.

member.name: M:Orleans.Providers.Streams.PersistentStreams.StreamDeliveryFailureEntity.ReverseOrderTimestampTicks
member.summary: Returns the number of ticks from now (UTC) to the year 9683.
member.remarks: This is useful for ordering the most recent failures at the start of the partition. While useful for efficient table storage queries, under heavy failure load this may cause a hot spot in the table. This is not an expected occurrence, but if it happens, we recommend subdividing your row key with some other field (stream namespace?).

member.name: T:Orleans.AzureUtils.AzureQueueDefaultPolicies
member.summary:
How to use the Queue Storage Service: http://www.windowsazure.com/en-us/develop/net/how-to-guides/queue-service/ Windows Azure Storage Abstractions and their Scalability Targets: http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2010/05/10/windows-azure-storage-abstractions-and-their-scalability-targets.aspx Naming Queues and Metadata: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windowsazure/dd179349.aspx Windows Azure Queues and Windows Azure Service Bus Queues - Compared and Contrasted: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh767287(VS.103).aspx Status and Error Codes: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd179382.aspx
http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/tags/scalability/ http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2010/12/30/windows-azure-storage-architecture-overview.aspx http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2010/11/06/how-to-get-most-out-of-windows-azure-tables.aspx

member.name: T:Orleans.AzureUtils.AzureStorageUtils
member.summary: General utility functions related to Azure storage.
member.remarks: These functions are mostly intended for internal usage by Orleans runtime, but due to certain assembly packaging constrants this class needs to have public visibility.

member.name: F:Orleans.AzureUtils.AzureStorageUtils.ANY_ETAG
member.summary: ETag of value "*" to match any etag for conditional table operations (update, nerge, delete).

member.name: M:Orleans.AzureUtils.AzureStorageUtils.TableStorageDataNotFound(System.Exception)
member.summary: Inspect an exception returned from Azure storage libraries to check whether it means that attempt was made to read some data that does not exist in storage table.
member.param: Exception that was returned by Azure storage library operation
member.returns: True if this exception means the data being read was not present in Azure table storage

member.name: M:Orleans.AzureUtils.AzureStorageUtils.ExtractRestErrorCode(System.Exception)
member.summary: Extract REST error code from DataServiceClientException or DataServiceQueryException
member.param: Exception to be inspected.
member.returns: Returns REST error code if found, otherwise null

member.name: M:Orleans.AzureUtils.AzureStorageUtils.EvaluateException(System.Exception,System.Net.HttpStatusCode@,System.String@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Examine a storage exception, and if applicable extracts the HTTP status code, and REST error code if getRESTErrors=true.
member.param: Exeption to be examined.
Output HTTP status code if applicable, otherwise HttpStatusCode.Unused (306)
When getRESTErrors=true, will output REST error code if applicable, otherwise null
Whether REST error code should also be examined / extracted.
member.returns: Returns true if HTTP status code and REST error were extracted.

member.summary: Returns true if the specified HTTP status / error code is returned in a transient / retriable error condition

REST error code value
member.returns: true if this is a transient / retriable error condition

member.name: M:Orleans.AzureUtils.AzureStorageUtils.IsContentionError(System.Net.HttpStatusCode)

member.returns: Returns true if the HTTP status code is due to storage contention.

member.name: M:Orleans.AzureUtils.AzureTableDataManager`1.CreateTableEntryAsync(`0)
member.summary: Create a new data entry in the Azure table (insert new, not update existing). Fails if the data already exists.
member.param: Data to be inserted into the table.
member.returns: Value promise with new Etag for this data entry after completing this storage operation.

member.name: M:Orleans.AzureUtils.AzureTableDataManager`1.UpsertTableEntryAsync(`0)
member.summary: Inserts a data entry in the Azure table: creates a new one if does not exists or overwrites (without eTag) an already existing version (the "update in place" semantincs).
member.param: Data to be inserted or replaced in the table.
member.returns: Value promise with new Etag for this data entry after completing this storage operation.

ETag to apply.
member.returns: Value promise with new Etag for this data entry after completing this storage operation.

members.member:
Updates a data entry in the Azure table: updates an already existing data in the table, by using eTag. Fails if the data does not already exist or of eTag does not match.
Data to be updated into the table. /// ETag to use. Value promise with new Etag for this data entry after completing this storage operation.

ETag to use.
member.returns: Completion promise for this storage operation.
